write a code for img genretive ai tools
ChatGPT said:

Nice — here are two practical, ready-to-run examples you can use to build an image-generative AI tool. I made them easy to adapt: one is a local Python + Diffusers (Stable Diffusion) pipeline (best if you want full control and run locally / on a GPU), and the other is a simple web API + Gradio UI wrapper so you can turn it into a tiny app.

Pick the one that fits you. I included install steps, safety notes, and minimal config. You can copy/paste and run.

1) Local text-to-image (Stable Diffusion / Hugging Face Diffusers)

Works on GPU (recommended). Requires a Hugging Face token with model access.

Installation:

bash
# create venv (optional)
python -m venv venv && source venv/bin/activate

# install core libs
pip install torch torchvision --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu118  # adjust for your CUDA
pip install diffusers[torch] transformers accelerate safetensors
pip install pillow

txt2img.py:

python
"""
Simple text->image script using Hugging Face diffusers (Stable Diffusion).
Adjust model_id to your preferred checkpoint (e.g., "runwayml/stable-diffusion-v1-5" or another).
Requires HF_TOKEN in env.
"""

import os
from diffusers import StableDiffusionPipeline
import torch
from PIL import Image

# Config
MODEL_ID = "runwayml/stable-diffusion-v1-5"  # change if needed
DEVICE = "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu"
HF_TOKEN = os.environ.get("HF_TOKEN")  # set export HF_TOKEN="your_hf_token"

def load_pipeline(model_id: str, token: str):
    pipe = StableDiffusionPipeline.from_pretrained(
        model_id,
        use_safetensors=True,
        torch_dtype=torch.float16 if DEVICE == "cuda" else torch.float32,
        revision="fp16" if DEVICE == "cuda" else None,
        safety_checker=None  # optional: add safety checker if desired
    )
    pipe.to(DEVICE)
    # enable xformers memory efficient attention if available
    try:
        pipe.enable_xformers_memory_efficient_attention()
    except Exception:
        pass
    return pipe

def generate(prompt: str, out_path: str = "output.png", steps: int = 28, seed: int = None, guidance_scale: float = 7.5, height=512, width=512):
    if seed is not None:
        generator = torch.Generator(device=DEVICE).manual_seed(seed)
    else:
        generator = None

    pipe = load_pipeline(MODEL_ID, HF_TOKEN)
    print(f"Generating on {DEVICE} | model {MODEL_ID}")
    image = pipe(
        prompt,
        num_inference_steps=steps,
        guidance_scale=guidance_scale,
        generator=generator,
        height=height,
        width=width,
    ).images[0]

    image.save(out_path)
    print(f"Saved: {out_path}")
    return out_path

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # Example usage:
    prompt = "A photorealistic portrait of a happy young student studying with a laptop, warm sunlight"
    generate(prompt, out_path="student.png", steps=30, seed=42)

Notes:

  • If GPU available, use torch_dtype=torch.float16 to save memory.

  • Replace MODEL_ID with whichever HF model you prefer. You’ll need a valid Hugging Face token in HF_TOKEN.

  • Add safety checker back if you want explicit content filtering.

2) Small Web App (FastAPI + Gradio UI) — serve image gen via HTTP and interactive UI

Installation:

bash
pip install fastapi uvicorn gradio diffusers transformers torch pillow

app.py:

python
"""
Run a small web app with Gradio UI and a simple API endpoint for text->image.
Start with: uvicorn app:app --reload
Open Gradio UI at printed URL or call /generate via HTTP.
"""

import os
import asyncio
from fastapi import FastAPI
from pydantic import BaseModel
from diffusers import StableDiffusionPipeline
import torch
import gradio as gr

MODEL_ID = "runwayml/stable-diffusion-v1-5"
DEVICE = "cuda" if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu"

# Load pipeline once (async-friendly)
pipe = None

def init_pipeline():
    global pipe
    if pipe is None:
        pipe = StableDiffusionPipeline.from_pretrained(
            MODEL_ID,
            torch_dtype=torch.float16 if DEVICE == "cuda" else torch.float32,
            use_safetensors=True,
        )
        pipe.to(DEVICE)
        try:
            pipe.enable_xformers_memory_efficient_attention()
        except Exception:
            pass

# API model
class GenRequest(BaseModel):
    prompt: str
    steps: int = 28
    guidance_scale: float = 7.5
    seed: int | None = None

app = FastAPI()

@app.on_event("startup")
async def startup_event():
    # initialize heavy model in background
    loop = asyncio.get_event_loop()
    await loop.run_in_executor(None, init_pipeline)

@app.post("/generate")
async def generate(req: GenRequest):
    init_pipeline()
    generator = None
    if req.seed is not None:
        generator = torch.Generator(device=DEVICE).manual_seed(req.seed)
    result = pipe(
        req.prompt,
        num_inference_steps=req.steps,
        guidance_scale=req.guidance_scale,
        generator=generator
    )
    img = result.images[0]

    # Save and return path (for demo). In production return bytes or base64.
    out_path = "out.png"
    img.save(out_path)
    return {"filename": out_path}

# ----------------
# Gradio UI (runs in same process)
# ----------------
def gradio_generate(prompt, steps=28, guidance=7.5, seed=42):
    init_pipeline()
    generator = torch.Generator(device=DEVICE).manual_seed(int(seed)) if seed is not None else None
    img = pipe(prompt, num_inference_steps=int(steps), guidance_scale=float(guidance), generator=generator).images[0]
    return img

def main_gradio():
    demo = gr.Interface(
        fn=gradio_generate,
        inputs=[
            gr.Textbox(lines=2, label="Prompt", placeholder="A cute cat astronaut..."),
            gr.Slider(1, 50, value=28, label="Steps"),
            gr.Slider(1.0, 15.0, value=7.5, label="Guidance scale"),
            gr.Number(value=42, label="Seed (optional)")
        ],
        outputs=gr.Image(type="pil"),
        title="Tiny Image Generator",
        description="Text-to-image demo using Diffusers"
    )
    demo.launch(server_name="0.0.0.0", share=False)

if __name__ == "__main__":
    # If you want to run directly: start FastAPI with uvicorn, and separately run gradio if desired.
    main_gradio()

How to run:

  • For API: uvicorn app:app --reload

  • The Gradio UI is started by running python app.py (it will open a port and show UI).

3) Quick JS (client) example calling a server endpoint

If you build the /generate endpoint above, a simple fetch from browser:

js
async function generateImage(prompt) {
  const payload = { prompt, steps: 28, guidance_scale: 7.5, seed: 42 };
  const r = await fetch("/generate", {
    method: "POST",
    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
    body: JSON.stringify(payload)
  });
  const json = await r.json();
  console.log("Saved:", json.filename);
  // If endpoint returned image bytes/base64 you'd create an img element
}

Safety, costs & practical tips

  • Safety: Filter prompts and add a safety checker if you will expose to public. Diffusers had a built-in safety_checker (may be disabled in some models) — consider running outputs through a content filter.

  • GPU: text->image is heavy. Use GPU with sufficient VRAM (8+ GB minimum for small images; 16+GB recommended for larger/resolutions).

  • Licensing / models: respect model license terms (some checkpoints require non-commercial use or have other constraints).

  • Scaling: For many concurrent users, consider queueing, batching, or using a cloud API (Replicate / Stability / OpenAI image APIs) rather than hosting locally.

  • Speed: Lower steps (20–30) for faster outputs. Use accelerate and xformers where supported.

1) Required tools / libraries

Install these in a virtualenv:

bash
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate

pip install python-telegram-bot==20.3 langchain openai faiss-cpu sentence-transformers pydub gTTS langdetect aiohttp requests

Notes:

  • faiss-cpu for vector DB. If you have GPU, use faiss-gpu.

  • sentence-transformers used by LangChain embeddings fallback if needed.

  • pydub for audio file conversions (requires ffmpeg installed on system).

  • gTTS for TTS (supports Hindi/Hinglish).

  • You need ffmpeg installed on system (for audio conversion). On Ubuntu: sudo apt install ffmpeg.

import os

OPENAI_API_KEY = os.getenv("OPENAI_API_KEY")
TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN = os.getenv("TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN")
BOT_OWNER = os.getenv("BOT_OWNER", "User")
# LangChain / FAISS settings
VECTOR_DB_PATH = "faiss_index"
PERSIST_VECTORS = True

4) File: vector_store.py (LangChain + FAISS wrapper)

python
# vector_store.py
from langchain.embeddings import OpenAIEmbeddings
from langchain.vectorstores import FAISS
from langchain.docstore.document import Document
import os
from bot_config import VECTOR_DB_PATH, PERSIST_VECTORS

class VectorStore:
    def __init__(self):
        self.emb = OpenAIEmbeddings()
        self.index = None
        # try load existing
        if PERSIST_VECTORS and os.path.exists(VECTOR_DB_PATH):
            try:
                self.index = FAISS.load_local(VECTOR_DB_PATH, self.emb)
            except Exception:
                self.index = None

    def add_text(self, text, metadata=None):
        doc = Document(page_content=text, metadata=metadata or {})
        if self.index is None:
            self.index = FAISS.from_documents([doc], self.emb)
        else:
            self.index.add_documents([doc])
        if PERSIST_VECTORS:
            self.index.save_local(VECTOR_DB_PATH)

    def similar_texts(self, query, k=4):
        if self.index is None:
            return []
        docs = self.index.similarity_search(query, k=k)
        return [d.page_content for d in docs]

5) File: language_utils.py (detect language & route)

python
# language_utils.py
from langdetect import detect, DetectorFactory
DetectorFactory.seed = 0

def detect_language(text: str) -> str:
    try:
        lang = detect(text)
        # map to simple categories
        if lang.startswith("hi"):
            return "hi"
        if lang.startswith("en"):
            return "en"
        return lang
    except Exception:
        return "en"

6) File: voice_utils.py (STT & TTS)

python
# voice_utils.py
import os
import requests
from gtts import gTTS
from pydub import AudioSegment
from pathlib import Path
from bot_config import OPENAI_API_KEY

TMP_DIR = Path("tmp")
TMP_DIR.mkdir(exist_ok=True)

# Transcribe using OpenAI Whisper (via API) - requires you to have OpenAI audio endpoint access
# This function downloads file_path (ogg/voice) -> converts to mp3/wav -> sends to OpenAI
def transcribe_audio(file_path: str) -> str:
    # If you don't have OpenAI audio access, you can use local speech-to-text libs (not included)
    import openai
    openai.api_key = OPENAI_API_KEY
    # convert to wav
    wav_path = str(TMP_DIR / "conv.wav")
    AudioSegment.from_file(file_path).export(wav_path, format="wav")
    with open(wav_path, "rb") as f:
        # Use OpenAI whisper API (model: "gpt-4o-transcribe" or "whisper-1" depending on availability)
        resp = openai.Audio.transcribe("whisper-1", f)
    return resp["text"]

def tts_text(text: str, lang="hi", out_path=None) -> str:
    # lang = 'hi' for Hindi, 'en' for English; gTTS supports many langs
    out_path = out_path or str(TMP_DIR / "tts.mp3")
    tts = gTTS(text=text, lang=lang)
    tts.save(out_path)
    return out_path

def convert_mp3_to_ogg(path_mp3: str, out_ogg: str):
    AudioSegment.from_file(path_mp3).export(out_ogg, format="ogg")
    return out_ogg

Notes:

  • If you can't use OpenAI audio, remove transcribe_audio and implement local STT like Vosk.

7) File: chat_agent.py (LangChain LLM agent wrapper + memory)

python
# chat_agent.py
from langchain.chat_models import ChatOpenAI
from langchain.prompts import SystemMessage, HumanMessage, AIMessage
from bot_config import OPENAI_API_KEY
from vector_store import VectorStore
from language_utils import detect_language

import os
os.environ["OPENAI_API_KEY"] = OPENAI_API_KEY

class ChatAgent:
    def __init__(self, temperature=0.4):
        # Use ChatOpenAI (will use gpt-4o or gpt-4 if available via your key)
        self.llm = ChatOpenAI(temperature=temperature, model="gpt-4o-mini")  # change model if not available
        self.vstore = VectorStore()
        # short-term memory (simple list)
        self.conversations = {}  # user_id -> list of messages

    def _system_prompt(self, mode="student"):
        # Dual personality system prompt
        if mode == "student":
            return ("You are 'SmartStudy' — a friendly student assistant. "
                    "Explain concepts simply, give step-by-step answers, and give examples and practice problems.")
        else:
            return ("You are 'ContentMate' — creative assistant for social content. "
                    "Provide catchy titles, short video scripts, hooks, and captions optimized for engagement.")

    def handle_message(self, user_id: str, text: str, mode="student"):
        # detect language
        lang = detect_language(text)
        # build few-shot with memory + relevant docs
        convo = self.conversations.get(user_id, [])
        convo.append({"role":"user", "content": text})
        self.conversations[user_id] = convo[-12:]  # keep last 12 messages

        # retrieve similar texts from vector store
        relevant = self.vstore.similar_texts(text, k=3)
        context_block = "\n\n".join(relevant)

        sys_msg = SystemMessage(content=self._system_prompt(mode) + f"\n\nRelevant notes:\n{context_block}")
        # convert conversation to LangChain messages
        messages = [sys_msg]
        for m in convo:
            if m["role"] == "user":
                messages.append(HumanMessage(content=m["content"]))
            else:
                messages.append(AIMessage(content=m["content"]))

        # call LLM
        resp = self.llm(messages)
        answer = resp.content
        # append to conversation
        self.conversations[user_id].append({"role":"assistant", "content": answer})
        # optionally add the QA to vector store for long-term memory
        self.vstore.add_text(f"Q: {text}\nA: {answer}", metadata={"user_id": user_id})
        return answer, lang

Notes:

  • ChatOpenAI model param can be changed; if gpt-4o-mini is unavailable, use "gpt-4o" or "gpt-3.5-turbo".

8) File: telegram_bot.py (main)

python
# telegram_bot.py
import logging
from telegram import Update, InputFile
from telegram.ext import ApplicationBuilder, CommandHandler, MessageHandler, ContextTypes, filters
from bot_config import TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN, BOT_OWNER
from chat_agent import ChatAgent
from voice_utils import transcribe_audio, tts_text, convert_mp3_to_ogg
import asyncio
import os

logging.basicConfig(level=logging.INFO)
logger = logging.getLogger(__name__)

agent = ChatAgent()

# default mode storage
user_modes = {}  # user_id -> "student" or "creator"

async def start(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user = update.effective_user
    text = (f"Hello {user.first_name}! I am SmartStudy+ContentMate bot.\n"
            "Commands:\n"
            "/mode student - Study mode\n"
            "/mode creator - Content creator mode\n"
            "/save <text> - Save this note to bot memory\n"
            "Send voice message or text and I'll reply.")
    await update.message.reply_text(text)

async def mode_cmd(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user_id = str(update.effective_user.id)
    args = context.args
    if not args:
        await update.message.reply_text("Usage: /mode student OR /mode creator")
        return
    mode = args[0].lower()
    if mode not in ["student", "creator"]:
        await update.message.reply_text("Choose 'student' or 'creator'")
        return
    user_modes[user_id] = mode
    await update.message.reply_text(f"Mode set to {mode}")

async def save_note(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user_id = str(update.effective_user.id)
    text = " ".join(context.args)
    if not text:
        await update.message.reply_text("Usage: /save Your note here")
        return
    agent.vstore.add_text(text, metadata={"user_id": user_id})
    await update.message.reply_text("Note saved to memory ✅")

async def handle_text(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user_id = str(update.effective_user.id)
    text = update.message.text
    mode = user_modes.get(user_id, "student")
    await update.message.reply_text("Soch raha hu... thoda samay lagega 🧠")
    answer, lang = agent.handle_message(user_id, text, mode=mode)
    # If detected Hindi, reply normally. For TTS, create voice if user asked
    await update.message.reply_text(answer)

async def handle_voice(update: Update, context: ContextTypes.DEFAULT_TYPE):
    user_id = str(update.effective_user.id)
    mode = user_modes.get(user_id, "student")
    voice = update.message.voice or update.message.voice_note
    if not voice:
        await update.message.reply_text("Voice message nahi mila.")
        return
    file = await context.bot.get_file(voice.file_id)
    local_ogg = f"tmp/{voice.file_id}.ogg"
    os.makedirs("tmp", exist_ok=True)
    await file.download_to_drive(local_ogg)
    await update.message.reply_text("Audio receive kiya, transcribing...")
    try:
        text = transcribe_audio(local_ogg)
    except Exception as e:
        logger.exception(e)
        await update.message.reply_text("Audio transcription failed. Try again in text.")
        return
    await update.message.reply_text(f"Transcribed: {text}\nGenerating answer...")
    answer, lang = agent.handle_message(user_id, text, mode=mode)
    await update.message.reply_text(answer)
    # also send TTS audio
    try:
        lang_code = "hi" if lang.startswith("hi") else "en"
        tts_path = tts_text(answer, lang=lang_code, out_path=f"tmp/resp_{user_id}.mp3")
        ogg_path = f"tmp/resp_{user_id}.ogg"
        convert_mp3_to_ogg(tts_path, ogg_path)
        await update.message.reply_audio(audio=InputFile(ogg_path))
    except Exception as e:
        logger.exception(e)

def main():
    app = ApplicationBuilder().token(TELEGRAM_BOT_TOKEN).build()
    app.add_handler(CommandHandler("start", start))
    app.add_handler(CommandHandler("mode", mode_cmd))
    app.add_handler(CommandHandler("save", save_note))
    app.add_handler(MessageHandler(filters.TEXT & ~filters.COMMAND, handle_text))
    app.add_handler(MessageHandler(filters.VOICE | filters.AUDIO, handle_voice))
    print("Bot started...")
    app.run_polling()

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

9) How it works — flow summary

  1. User messages Telegram bot (text or voice).

  2. Bot detects user mode (student/creator) and language.

  3. Bot queries vector DB for relevant context (long-term memory).

  4. Bot builds system prompt (dual personality) + conversation context and calls LLM.

  5. Response saved back to vector DB (so it learns) and replied.

  6. Voice messages are transcribed via OpenAI Whisper (if available) and reply also returned as voice via gTTS.

10) Deployment instructions (quick)

  • On your local machine: python telegram_bot.py

  • For 24/7: deploy on VPS (Ubuntu), use systemd service or pm2 to keep running.

  • Alternatively use Railway/Render/Heroku with worker process that runs the bot; set env vars there.

11) Cost & safety notes

  • OpenAI LLM + embedding + audio transcription will cost money — monitor usage.

  • Add prompt sanitization and content filters before saving to vector DB if you plan to open for public.

  • Rate-limit user requests to avoid overuse.

12) Optional enhancements (I can add)

  • Web UI (React) for chat + upload notes (syncs to vector DB).

  • RAG with PDF uploader: parse PDFs into chunks and store in vector store (I can provide code).

  • Better TTS (ElevenLabs) for higher quality voice (paid).

  • Admin panel to view saved memory and delete user memory.

  • More robust conversation memory (LangChain memory integrations).

🔹 Step 1: OpenAI API Key lo

🔹 Step 2: Blogger me Add karo

  1. Blogger dashboard → “Theme” → “Edit HTML”

  2. <body> ke end me niche wala code paste karo 👇

html
<!-- Simple AI Chatbot -->
<div id="chatbot" style="position:fixed;bottom:20px;right:20px;width:300px;background:white;border:1px solid #ccc;border-radius:10px;box-shadow:0 0 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);">
  <div style="background:#4CAF50;color:white;padding:10px;border-radius:10px 10px 0 0;">
    AI Chatbot
  </div>
  <div id="chatbox" style="height:300px;overflow-y:auto;padding:10px;font-family:sans-serif;font-size:14px;"></div>
  <div style="display:flex;">
    <input id="userInput" type="text" placeholder="Type your message..." style="flex:1;padding:10px;border:none;border-top:1px solid #ccc;">
    <button onclick="sendMessage()" style="padding:10px;background:#4CAF50;color:white;border:none;">➤</button>
  </div>
</div>

<script>
const apiKey = "PASTE_YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY_HERE"; // <--- Yahan apni API key dalna

async function sendMessage() {
  const input = document.getElementById("userInput");
  const message = input.value.trim();
  if (!message) return;

  const chatbox = document.getElementById("chatbox");
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>You:</b> ${message}</div>`;
  input.value = "";

  // OpenAI API request
  const response = await fetch("https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions", {
    method: "POST",
    headers: {
      "Content-Type": "application/json",
      "Authorization": "Bearer " + apiKey
    },
    body: JSON.stringify({
      model: "gpt-3.5-turbo",
      messages: [{ role: "user", content: message }]
    })
  });

  const data = await response.json();
  const reply = data.choices[0].message.content;

  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>Bot:</b> ${reply}</div>`;
  chatbox.scrollTop = chatbox.scrollHeight;
}
</script>

🔹 Part 1: Backend (Safe API Key)

Aapko ek small server banana hoga (Heroku / Render / Railway / Vercel sab free option dete hain).

👉 Example: server.js (Node.js backend)

javascript
import express from "express";
import fetch from "node-fetch";
import bodyParser from "body-parser";
import cors from "cors";

const app = express();
app.use(cors());
app.use(bodyParser.json());

const API_KEY = "YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY"; // 👈 yaha apna API key rakho (safe backend me)

app.post("/chat", async (req, res) => {
  try {
    const userMessage = req.body.message;

    const response = await fetch("https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions", {
      method: "POST",
      headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": `Bearer ${API_KEY}`
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: "gpt-3.5-turbo",
        messages: [{ role: "user", content: userMessage }]
      })
    });

    const data = await response.json();
    res.json({ reply: data.choices[0].message.content });
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(500).json({ error: "Something went wrong" });
  }
});

app.listen(3000, () => console.log("Server running on port 3000"));

👉 Ab isko deploy karo (Heroku/Render pe).
Maan lo backend ka URL mila:

arduino
https://mychatbot.onrender.com/chat

  <div style="background:#4CAF50;color:white;padding:10px;border-radius:10px 10px 0 0;">
    AI Chatbot

  <div style="display:flex;">
    <input id="userInput" type="text" placeholder="Type your message..." style="flex:1;padding:10px;border:none;border-top:1px solid #ccc;">
    <button onclick="sendMessage()" style="padding:10px;background:#4CAF50;color:white;border:none;">➤</button>

<script>
const BACKEND_URL = "https://mychatbot.onrender.com/chat"; // 👈 yaha apna backend URL dalna

async function sendMessage() {
  const input = document.getElementById("userInput");
  const message = input.value.trim();
  if (!message) return;

  const chatbox = document.getElementById("chatbox");
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>You:</b> ${message}</div>`;
  input.value = "";

  const response = await fetch(BACKEND_URL, {
    method: "POST",
    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
    body: JSON.stringify({ message })
  });

  const data = await response.json();
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>Bot:</b> ${data.reply}</div>`;
  chatbox.scrollTop = chatbox.scrollHeight;
}
</script>

javascript
// server.js
import express from "express";
import fetch from "node-fetch";
import bodyParser from "body-parser";
import cors from "cors";

const app = express();
app.use(cors());
app.use(bodyParser.json());

const OPENAI_KEY = "YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY"; // 👈 yahan apni OpenAI key rakho

app.post("/chat", async (req, res) => {
  try {
    const message = req.body.message;

    const response = await fetch("https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions", {
      method: "POST",
      headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": `Bearer ${OPENAI_KEY}`
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: "gpt-3.5-turbo",
        messages: [{ role: "user", content: message }]
      })
    });

    const data = await response.json();
    res.json({ reply: data.choices[0].message.content });
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(500).json({ error: "Something went wrong" });
  }
});

app.listen(3000, () => console.log("Backend running on port 3000"));

<!-- BrainBuddy Chatbot with Dual Mode -->
<div id="brainbuddy" style="position:fixed;bottom:20px;right:20px;width:320px;background:white;border:1px solid #ccc;border-radius:10px;box-shadow:0 0 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);font-family:sans-serif;">

    <span>BrainBuddy 🤖</span>
    <select id="modeSelect" style="padding:2px;border:none;border-radius:5px;">
      <option value="study">Study Mode</option>
      <option value="content">Content Mode</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div id="chatbox" style="height:300px;overflow-y:auto;padding:10px;"></div>
  <div style="display:flex;">
    <input id="userInput" type="text" placeholder="Type your message..." style="flex:1;padding:10px;border:none;border-top:1px solid #ccc;">
    <button onclick="sendMessage()" style="padding:10px;background:#4CAF50;color:white;border:none;">➤</button>
  </div>

<script>
const BACKEND_URL = "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat"; // 👈 backend URL yahan daale

async function sendMessage() {
  const input = document.getElementById("userInput");
  const message = input.value.trim();
  if(!message) return;

  const chatbox = document.getElementById("chatbox");
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>You:</b> ${message}</div>`;
  input.value = "";

  const mode = document.getElementById("modeSelect").value; // study / content

  // Send mode info to backend
  const response = await fetch(BACKEND_URL, {
    method: "POST",
    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
    body: JSON.stringify({ message, mode })
  });

  const data = await response.json();
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>BrainBuddy (${mode}):</b> ${data.reply}</div>`;
  chatbox.scrollTop = chatbox.scrollHeight;
}
</script>

Main aapke liye BrainBuddy AI Chatbot ka ready-to-use complete code bana deta hoon, jo aap Blogger post me paste kar ke turant live kar sakte ho. Ye code dual-mode (Study + Content) ke saath hai aur backend safe rakhta hai.

🔹 Step 1: Backend (Safe OpenAI Key)

Node.js + Express Backend Example (server.js)

javascript
import express from "express";
import fetch from "node-fetch";
import bodyParser from "body-parser";
import cors from "cors";

const app = express();
app.use(cors());
app.use(bodyParser.json());

const OPENAI_KEY = "YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY"; // 👈 yahan apna OpenAI key rakho

app.post("/chat", async (req, res) => {
  try {
    const { message, mode } = req.body;

    // Mode ke hisab se system prompt
    let systemPrompt = "";
    if(mode === "study") {
      systemPrompt = "You are BrainBuddy, a friendly study assistant. Explain concepts simply and give examples.";
    } else {
      systemPrompt = "You are BrainBuddy, a creative content assistant. Generate YouTube/Instagram scripts, ideas, and captions.";
    }

    const response = await fetch("https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions", {
      method: "POST",
      headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": `Bearer ${OPENAI_KEY}`
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: "gpt-3.5-turbo",
        messages: [
          { role: "system", content: systemPrompt },
          { role: "user", content: message }
        ]
      })
    });

    const data = await response.json();
    res.json({ reply: data.choices[0].message.content });
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(500).json({ error: "Something went wrong" });
  }
});

app.listen(3000, () => console.log("Backend running on port 3000"));

✅ Deploy options: Render / Railway / Heroku / Vercel (Free)

  • Backend URL example: https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat

🔹 Step 2: Blogger Embed Code (HTML + JS)

html
<!-- BrainBuddy AI Chatbot -->
<div id="brainbuddy" style="position:fixed;bottom:20px;right:20px;width:320px;background:white;border:1px solid #ccc;border-radius:10px;box-shadow:0 0 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);font-family:sans-serif;">
  <div style="background:#4CAF50;color:white;padding:10px;border-radius:10px 10px 0 0;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;align-items:center;">
    <span>BrainBuddy 🤖</span>
    <select id="modeSelect" style="padding:2px;border:none;border-radius:5px;">
      <option value="study">Study Mode</option>
      <option value="content">Content Mode</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div id="chatbox" style="height:300px;overflow-y:auto;padding:10px;"></div>
  <div style="display:flex;">
    <input id="userInput" type="text" placeholder="Type your message..." style="flex:1;padding:10px;border:none;border-top:1px solid #ccc;">
    <button onclick="sendMessage()" style="padding:10px;background:#4CAF50;color:white;border:none;">➤</button>
  </div>
</div>

<script>
const BACKEND_URL = "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat"; // 👈 apna backend URL

async function sendMessage() {
  const input = document.getElementById("userInput");
  const message = input.value.trim();
  if(!message) return;

  const chatbox = document.getElementById("chatbox");
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>You:</b> ${message}</div>`;
  input.value = "";

  const mode = document.getElementById("modeSelect").value;

  const response = await fetch(BACKEND_URL, {
    method: "POST",
    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
    body: JSON.stringify({ message, mode })
  });

  const data = await response.json();
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>BrainBuddy (${mode}):</b> ${data.reply}</div>`;
  chatbox.scrollTop = chatbox.scrollHeight;
}
</script>

import express from "express";
import fetch from "node-fetch";
import bodyParser from "body-parser";
import cors from "cors";

const app = express();
app.use(cors());
app.use(bodyParser.json());

app.post("/chat", async (req, res) => {
  try {
    const { message, mode } = req.body;

    let systemPrompt = "";
    if(mode === "study") {
      systemPrompt = "You are BrainBuddy, a friendly study assistant. Explain concepts simply and give examples.";
    } else {
      systemPrompt = "You are BrainBuddy, a creative content assistant. Generate YouTube/Instagram scripts, ideas, and captions.";
    }

    const response = await fetch("https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions", {
      method: "POST",
      headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": `Bearer ${OPENAI_KEY}`
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: "gpt-3.5-turbo",
        messages: [
          { role: "system", content: systemPrompt },
          { role: "user", content: message }
        ]
      })
    });

    const data = await response.json();
    res.json({ reply: data.choices[0].message.content });
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(500).json({ error: "Something went wrong" });
  }

### 1️⃣ Backend (Node.js server) * Ye **alagh file** hai (`server.js`) * **Purpose:** OpenAI API key safe rakhna aur requests handle karna * **Kahan:** Apne PC / se

🔹 Backend (Node.js server) ka explanation

1️⃣ Kya hai backend?

  • Backend ek server-side program hai jo aapke chatbot aur OpenAI ke API ke beech ka bridge ka kaam karta hai.

  • Matlab: Jab aap Blogger me type karte ho → request backend ko jaati hai → backend OpenAI API ko call karta hai → response wapas frontend (Blogger) me bhejta hai.

2️⃣ Kyu alagh file hai?

  • Backend me OpenAI API key rakhi hoti hai.

  • Agar aap isko direct Blogger me paste kar do → sab log API key dekh sakte hain → risk!

  • Isliye backend ko alagh server/file (server.js) me rakha jata hai.

3️⃣ Backend ka kaam

  1. Receive user message: Frontend se message + mode (study/content) receive karta hai

  2. Prepare system prompt: Mode ke hisab se instruction set karta hai (study ya content)

  3. Call OpenAI API: ChatGPT model se reply mangta hai

  4. Send reply back: Frontend ko reply wapas bhejta hai

4️⃣ Backend kahan run kare?

  • Local PC pe testing ke liye run kar sakte ho:

    nginx
    node server.js

  • Live hosting ke liye free services:

    • Render → simple UI, free tier

    • Railway → beginner-friendly

    • Heroku → widely used

    • Vercel → fast deployment

  • Backend URL example (live):

    arduino
    https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat

    Ye URL frontend me use karna hai.

🔹 Summary

  • Backend = safe server jaha API key rahegi

  • Frontend = Blogger me visible chatbot UI

  • Dono ko alagh alagh rakho → secure + functional

Agar chaho to mai aapko ek simple diagram ke saath dikhau ki kaise Frontend ↔ Backend ↔ OpenAI API interact karte hain, taaki aur easy samajh aaye.

import express from "express";
import fetch from "node-fetch";
import bodyParser from "body-parser";
import cors from "cors";

const app = express();
app.use(cors());
app.use(bodyParser.json());

const OPENAI_KEY = "YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY"; // 👈 yahan apna OpenAI key rakho

app.post("/chat", async (req, res) => {
  try {
    const { message, mode } = req.body;

    let systemPrompt = "";
    if(mode === "study") {
      systemPrompt = "You are BrainBuddy, a friendly study assistant. Explain concepts simply and give examples.";
    } else {
      systemPrompt = "You are BrainBuddy, a creative content assistant. Generate YouTube/Instagram scripts, ideas, and captions.";
    }

    const response = await fetch("https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions", {
      method: "POST",
      headers: {
        "Content-Type": "application/json",
        "Authorization": `Bearer ${OPENAI_KEY}`
      },
      body: JSON.stringify({
        model: "gpt-3.5-turbo",
        messages: [
          { role: "system", content: systemPrompt },
          { role: "user", content: message }
        ]
      })
    });

    const data = await response.json();
    res.json({ reply: data.choices[0].message.content });
  } catch (error) {
    res.status(500).json({ error: "Something went wrong" });
  }
});

app.listen(3000, () => console.log("Backend running on port 3000"));

4️⃣ Deploy on Render

  1. Start Command: node server.js

  2. Environment Variable:

    • Key: OPENAI_KEY

    • Value: Your OpenAI API key

  3. Click Deploy → wait 2–3 min → backend URL milega

    arduino
    https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat

✅ Backend ready!

Step 2: Blogger Frontend Setup

1️⃣ Create New Post

  1. Blogger → Dashboard → Posts → New Post

  2. Post Title: BrainBuddy AI Chatbot

2️⃣ Switch to HTML Mode

  1. Editor upar → Compose / HTML mode

  2. Select HTML

3️⃣ Paste Frontend Code

html
<!-- BrainBuddy AI Chatbot -->
<div id="brainbuddy" style="position:fixed;bottom:20px;right:20px;width:320px;background:white;border:1px solid #ccc;border-radius:10px;box-shadow:0 0 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);font-family:sans-serif;">
  <div style="background:#4CAF50;color:white;padding:10px;border-radius:10px 10px 0 0;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;align-items:center;">
    <span>BrainBuddy 🤖</span>
    <select id="modeSelect" style="padding:2px;border:none;border-radius:5px;">
      <option value="study">Study Mode</option>
      <option value="content">Content Mode</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  <div id="chatbox" style="height:300px;overflow-y:auto;padding:10px;"></div>
  <div style="display:flex;">
    <input id="userInput" type="text" placeholder="Type your message..." style="flex:1;padding:10px;border:none;border-top:1px solid #ccc;">
    <button onclick="sendMessage()" style="padding:10px;background:#4CAF50;color:white;border:none;">➤</button>
  </div>
</div>

<script>
const BACKEND_URL = "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat"; // 👈 Use your backend URL

async function sendMessage() {
  const input = document.getElementById("userInput");
  const message = input.value.trim();
  if(!message) return;

  const chatbox = document.getElementById("chatbox");
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>You:</b> ${message}</div>`;
  input.value = "";

  const mode = document.getElementById("modeSelect").value;

  const response = await fetch(BACKEND_URL, {
    method: "POST",
    headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
    body: JSON.stringify({ message, mode })
  });

  const data = await response.json();
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>BrainBuddy (${mode}):</b> ${data.reply}</div>`;
  chatbox.scrollTop = chatbox.scrollHeight;
}
</script>

4️⃣ Save & Publish

  • Save → Publish

  • Open Post → Bottom-right me BrainBuddy chatbot dikhega

  • Dropdown → Study / Content Mode toggle

✅ Done!

  • Chatbot live hai

  • Study questions aur content prompts dono handle karega

  • Backend safe → API key exposed nahi

You said:
 what is root dire. in render
ChatGPT said:

Good question Saurabh 👍

Jab aap Render pe backend deploy karte ho, to wahan ek setting aati hai Root Directory ki.

🔹 Root Directory ka matlab kya hai?

  • Ye batata hai ki aapke project ke andar kaunsa folder entry point hoga (matlab jahan se code run start hoga).

  • Agar aapka code seedha project ke main folder me hai (jaise server.js file main folder me rakhi hai), to Root Directory khali chhod dena.

  • Agar aapka code kisi folder ke andar hai (jaise /backend/server.js), to Root Directory me backend likhna hoga.

🔹 Render me Root Directory kab set karna hai?

  1. Single file (server.js, package.json root me hai)
    → Root Directory = . (ya blank chhod do) ✅

  2. Aapke code ka folder hai (jaise myapp/server.js)
    → Root Directory = myapp

Example:

pgsql
project/
 ├── server.js
 ├── package.json

➡ Root Directory: .

pgsql
project/
 ├── backend/
 │    ├── server.js
 │    ├── package.json
 ├── frontend/

➡ Root Directory: backend

👉 Tumhare case me jo code maine diya tha (server.js + package.json) agar tumne seedha hi upload kiya hai, to Root Directory blank chhod do ya . likho.

Chaho to mai tumhe ek sahi package.json file bhi bana kar de deta jisse Render automatically server run kare.

json

2. GitHub par Upload Karo

  1. Ek GitHub repo banao (e.g. brainbuddy-backend)

  2. Is folder (server.js + package.json) ko GitHub repo me upload kar do

3. Render me Deploy Karo

  1. https://render.com open karo

  2. "New +" → "Web Service" select karo

  3. GitHub connect karo aur apna repo select karo

  4. Settings me:

    • Root Directory: blank ya .

    • Build Command: npm install

    • Start Command: npm start

    • Environment: Node

  5. "Create Web Service" dabao

4. Deploy ke Baad

  • Render tumhe ek public URL dega, jaise:

    arduino
    https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com

  • Ab Blogger ke frontend code me:

    js
    const BACKEND_URL = "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat";

🔹 GitHub Alternative Options

1️⃣ Manual Upload (Render)

  • Render me “New → Web Service → Manual Deploy” option hota hai

  • Steps:

    1. Render dashboard → New → Web Service → Manual Deploy

    2. Project folder (server.js + package.json) zip file me upload karo

    3. Root Directory blank / . rakho

    4. Start Command: npm start

    5. Deploy → Render URL milega

2️⃣ ZIP Upload for Railway

  • Railway pe bhi aap GitHub ke bina deploy kar sakte ho:

    1. Railway dashboard → New Project → Deploy from ZIP file

    2. Zip file me server.js + package.json rakho

    3. Environment Variable: OPENAI_KEY set karo

    4. Deploy → URL milega

3️⃣ Local Tunneling (Temporary, Testing)

  • Agar aap sirf testing ke liye chahte ho, to localhost run karo aur ngrok ya localtunnel se public URL create karo

  • Example:

    bash
    npx ngrok http 3000

  • Ye temporary URL milega → use Blogger me BACKEND_URL me daalo

💡 Summary:

  • GitHub is convenient, lekin mandatory nahi

  • Manual Upload (Render / Railway) easiest option hai

  • Local + ngrok → temporary testing ke liye

🔹 Blogger Frontend Code (Copy-Paste)

html
<!-- BrainBuddy AI Chatbot -->
<div id="brainbuddy" style="position:fixed;bottom:20px;right:20px;width:320px;background:white;border:1px solid #ccc;border-radius:10px;box-shadow:0 0 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.3);font-family:sans-serif;">
  <!-- Header -->
  <div style="background:#4CAF50;color:white;padding:10px;border-radius:10px 10px 0 0;display:flex;justify-content:space-between;align-items:center;">
    <span>BrainBuddy 🤖</span>
    <select id="modeSelect" style="padding:2px;border:none;border-radius:5px;">
      <option value="study">Study Mode</option>
      <option value="content">Content Mode</option>
    </select>
  </div>
  
  <!-- Chat Box -->
  <div id="chatbox" style="height:300px;overflow-y:auto;padding:10px;"></div>
  
  <!-- Input -->
  <div style="display:flex;">
    <input id="userInput" type="text" placeholder="Type your message..." style="flex:1;padding:10px;border:none;border-top:1px solid #ccc;">
    <button onclick="sendMessage()" style="padding:10px;background:#4CAF50;color:white;border:none;">➤</button>
  </div>
</div>

<script>
const BACKEND_URL = "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat"; // 👈 Apna Render backend URL daalo

async function sendMessage() {
  const input = document.getElementById("userInput");
  const message = input.value.trim();
  if(!message) return;

  const chatbox = document.getElementById("chatbox");
  chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>You:</b> ${message}</div>`;
  input.value = "";

  const mode = document.getElementById("modeSelect").value;

  try {
    const response = await fetch(BACKEND_URL, {
      method: "POST",
      headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
      body: JSON.stringify({ message, mode })
    });

    const data = await response.json();
    chatbox.innerHTML += `<div><b>BrainBuddy (${mode}):</b> ${data.reply}</div>`;
    chatbox.scrollTop = chatbox.scrollHeight;
  } catch (error) {
    chatbox.innerHTML += `<div style="color:red;"><b>Error:</b> Could not reach server</div>`;
  }
}
</script>

Ah Saurabh, samajh gaya 😅. Agar aapka Blogger chatbot respond nahi kar raha, to iske kuch common reasons aur fixes hain:

1️⃣ Backend properly deploy hua hai ya nahi

  • Render / Railway me check karo → Server log me:

    arduino
    ✅ Server running on port 3000

  • Agar error aa raha hai → backend properly live nahi hai

2️⃣ Backend URL sahi daala hai ya nahi

  • Frontend code me BACKEND_URL exactly aapke live Render URL se match hona chahiye:

    js
    const BACKEND_URL = "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat";

  • Render URL me /chat endpoint include hona chahiye

3️⃣ CORS issue

  • Render backend me cors package use kiya hai:

    js
    app.use(cors());

  • Agar ye missing hai → frontend request block ho jayega

4️⃣ API key valid hai ya nahi

  • Backend me OpenAI API key properly set honi chahiye (environment variable ya server.js me):

    js
    const OPENAI_KEY = "YOUR_OPENAI_API_KEY";

  • Agar invalid hai → response nahi milega

5️⃣ Frontend test

  • Browser console open karo (F12 → Console tab)

  • Type karo aur check karo network request / errors

  • Agar failed request dikh raha hai → backend URL ya CORS / API key issue

💡 Quick fix test:

  1. Backend URL ko browser me khol ke check karo → 404 ya blank page normal hai

  2. Postman / curl se test karo:

bash
curl -X POST "https://brainbuddy-backend.onrender.com/chat" \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{"message":"hello","mode":"study"}'

  • Agar response aa raha hai → backend fine hai

  • Nahi → backend deploy me problem hai
